intro: Mainea racemosa, commonly known as the clustered milkweed, is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa and the Middle East. It belongs to the Apocynaceae family and is characterized by its slender, erect stems and clusters of small, greenish-white flowers. The plant produces a milky sap that is toxic to many animals, including insects and mammals. Its leaves are opposite, simple, and often have a waxy texture. Mainea racemosa typically grows in arid or semi-arid environments and is adapted to thrive in poor soil conditions.
